name: Nakeshia Latoya Lorde
bio: Bachelor of Science Electrical and Computer Engineering with 5 years experience as a Software Engineer

name: Raquel Seville
bio:
Raquel has a passion for pulling insights from data and has worked for large multi-national Telecoms serving customers in the Caribbean and Latin America. She has over a decade of experience working with and leading big data and analytics teams. She has designed and implemented data warehouses, management reports, predictive analytics and executive dashboards. She is author of recently published book, SAP OpenUI5 for Mobile BI and Analytics. 
Raquel is an international speaker and has spoken at conferences in the US, Spain, South Africa, Australia and her home country, Jamaica. Her recent presentation at BI+A 2018 was ranked #1 out of more than 100 speakers (Check her slideshare for presentations https://www.slideshare.net/mobile/RaquelSeville). She is a SAP Mentor and founder of BI blog exportBI.com, where you can find her sharing ideas about all things data. 
Raquel is a keen advocate of BI user adoption and having not only the right tools but the right talent and processes to ensure maximum return on BI investment. She recently helped to launch BI Brainz Caribbean, where she serves as the CEO. Similar to her passion for data, is a love for food, music and globetrotting. You can follow her @quelzseville and connect with her on LinkedIn.
description: I have spoken at various conferences globally, hosted panel discussions and discussions.

name: Kalifa Damani
bio: Kalifa is a researcher at the EdTech Hub (https://edtechhub.org/). Her research experience spans the fields of psychology, education and international development, with particular focus on the role of technology and media in those spheres. Kalifa has previously worked as a researcher at the University of the West Indies, where she also completed her BSc in Psychology, and at the University of Cambridge, where she also completed an MPhil at the Psychometrics Centre and a PhD at the centre for Research for Equitable Access and Learning.

name: Gabrielle Abraham
bio:
Education- MSc Geospatial Science 
Bsc - geography 
Current position- GIS research associate 
Owner of Incognito Experience event company in Dominica

description: Online public zoom interviews, Caribbean Girls Hack speaker

name: Majella Mark
bio: Majella Mark is a researcher, writer and artist, who have worked as a data analyst in the media tech industry for many years. She has conducted numerous workshops and collaborations such as The Pvssy Plate Painting Party, The Wakanda Workshop, Colorism in Conversation with The Guardian and Black Women's Day of Meditation. When she is not running a workshop or writing she is managing data analytics for the women's health justice group Womanly. Her published work can be seen in digital publications such as CultureBanx and An Injustice. She is also a member of the Black Women's Blueprint. You can follow her on Twitter @MajellaMark and Instagram @MetGodShesBlack. You can also find out more about Majella on www.majellamark.com

name: Leanna Dixon
bio: Leanna is an Associate Software Developer at an Asset Management company called Insight Investment. Leanna’s journey to a Developer began 2 years prior, during her undergraduate Biochemistry degree at the University of Manchester. After selecting a 3rd year project where she had to quickly learn to code to analyse her data, her love for coding bloomed. Whilst working full time as a Science Technician for one year, and then a Programmes manager at Generating Genius’, she completed virtual and physical courses from CodeFirstGirls, General Assembly, and Coursera, hackathons from CodeUntapped, events from CodeBox and becoming one of Google and the Dots Fast Track 50 professionals before starting her first Tech job at Insight Investment. Leanna is also a STEMGirls Ambassador and Alumni at Generating Genius, promoting girls and boys from ethnic minorities to pursue Science.
description: Talks about D&I, Black scientists and journey to tech at conferences (~200 people), events (~100 people) and Webinars (<200 people).

name: Melyssa Minto
bio: Melyssa Minto is from Jamaica, but was raised in Durham, NC. She received a B.S. in Mathematics and Biology at Meredith College. Currently, she is a PhD Candidate in the Computational Biology & Bioinformatics program at Duke University where she is researching how to use Bayesian statistics to model gene activating and silencing modifications bound to DNA throughout the maturation of neurons in the West Lab. Melyssa is passionate about empowering brown and black youth in Tech. She regularly volunteers with Black Girls Code and in local high schools.
jobTitle: Computational Biology & Bioinformatics Graduate Student at Duke University
description: 3 years of science talks. 5 years of personal journey talks

name: Chandelle O'Neil
bio:
I graduated with distinction in a Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Guelph honours program in 2017. During my course of study, I focused on Sustainable Energy Systems Design including waste heat recovery projects, methane biodigesters as well as several solar PV and wind turbine installations. 
I currently continue to attain relevant hands-on experience with my personal enterprise Mawu Energy Services, which offers energy assessments and audits as well as consultancy on process engineering for waste reduction. As a champion of protecting the environment, I am passionate about innovative technologies in renewable energy and I hope to use the knowledge I acquire to create greater efficiencies of resources used in our daily lives.
description: Youth Climate Experts with Building Bridges 4 Climate Action
